children.subject: Thank you for your interest! An email will be sent you with the zoom link.
where can we get the zoom link? I filled the interest already.
Yes, if you filled out the form you should have received the link in a separate email. If not, please let me know!
Hi, I just filled out the form, would I still be able to get the zoom link?

history.content:
Calling all students with a passion for graphics, simulations, music, movies, storytelling, teamwork, and/or yearlong projects!

Consider applying for NM190: Advanced Digital Animation, taught by Professor Dan Garcia, this semester. NM190 is a year-long animation course offered every other year. In this course, 24 students divide into 2 groups and spend the entire year creating an animated short film. Additionally, students have the opportunity to hone their skills through direct feedback from several industry speakers in all parts of the production pipeline. 

[IMPORTANT]: As this is an advanced course, applicants are expected to submit a portfolio showcasing their skills. While CS198: UCBUGG, Basic and Advanced, are informal prerequisites to the course, if you have work showcasing that your skills are at an equivalent level, you may still have a chance of getting into the course.

Additionally, to get the application you MUST attend the info session, which will be held virtually on August 26th, 1PM-3PM. To get the link to the info session, head to cnm190.com and fill out the interest form. To see past short films created from this class, click here.

Course Info

NM 190: Advanced Digital Animation is a year-long course offered at UC Berkeley which is targeted at students with backgrounds in art, film, or computer science who intend to work in the visual effects, animation, and entertainment industries. It will build upon students' knowlege from related courses to guide them through the digital animation production process in an environment similar to industry production houses. We will survey many advanced topics and allow students to focus on a subset they find interesting while collaborating with their team to develop a 30-second animation piece. Our class will be held MWF 1:00PM-3:00PM PST via Zoom.
